diff_analysis.evidence: In the OLD code, when DictCap is unset it is filled with (1<<31)-1, which is then only checked against MinDictCap and MaxDictCap. This effectively allows creation of an extremely large dictionary (close to 2GB) without further limiting or throttling, potentially causing excessive memory allocation and resource exhaustion (CWE-770). The NEW code changes the default to 1<<31, which likely aligns with updated MaxDictCap constraints, indicating the old default was an unsafe upper bound.
